page.title: 12ATTITUDES
page.content: On the first survey our group visited the public houses and other places where entertainment could take place.Only one pub offered any entertainment the Royal Oak in Aspley Heath has a very low ceiling.(Nicola) Ian, Marc and I went to the Library. Once it was a Quaker Meeting House. We went in and Mrs. Appleton said we could look at the gravestones. The lady at the library gave us a book about them and we found that the oldest was a lady who died on Christmas Day and the youngest was a three year old boy. Altogether there are 33 stones giving names of l7 men and 3l women but we could not read six of the stones.(Neil)
